summary: Senator Tower was a member of the Senate Select Committee (SSC), also known as the Church Committee, which investigated intelligence activities. He was involved in briefings regarding warrantless electronic surveillances and surreptitious entries conducted by the CIA. The documents indicate that Senator Tower was to be briefed on sensitive topics, including the identification of foreign targets and the CIA's domestic electronic surveillance operations. His role was primarily as a member of the committee overseeing and investigating these activities.
key_connections: FBI Special Agent William D. Campbell
significance: Senator Tower's significance lies in his role as a member of the Senate Select Committee investigating intelligence activities, including potential abuses of power by agencies like the CIA and FBI. While the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, his involvement in overseeing intelligence operations provides context to the broader investigation of governmental overreach during that era.
